ai-anya-e0105n9:1_0: At that time the kings had invited the Abhaya and Pāṭaliputta in the Commentaries with fourteen sections, and having arrived at the monastery, giving many other great primaries to be his direct-knowledge, and many other things.
ai-anya-e0105n9:1_1: So many mendicants honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated the mendicants.
ai-anya-e0105n9:1_2: Again, Abhaya was the most excellent Abhaya Vajjiputtaka when the Dhammāsoka had gone outside the Nigaṇṭha Gate. It was said to have confidence in the Dispensation, the Vajjiyamāhita, and the Vinaya, Dhammāhita, for the sake of the Vajjiputtas beginning with: Dhammāsoka, conversion with this Dhamma and warrior, Dhammāhsaka in verse:
ai-anya-e0105n9:1_3: and by the name of Aṅgīrasa as follows:
ai-anya-e0105n9:1_4: This is the second reason to make up the Dispensation.
